values:
So, '09 is over now.  Which is kind of crazy.  I think it was a good year overall for me.  Had a lot of fun, didn't do any school things which seems kind of weird.  My first entire year away from school. So bizarre.  The toga party was an excellent wrap up type of thing, bringing in the new year in ridiculous clothing is pretty great. 

'10 should be an interesting year.  I don't really know what else to say though I'm kind of drawing a blank on the whole having important things to say in here.  Hmmmm....I would like to do more different types of crafting in the next year...I'll have to work on that.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/192816.html

<lj-template lang="en_LJ" id="1080" name="qotd"></lj-template>no. I would not want a do-over of this day, this month, or this year...there are certain events I might want to live over just because they were so much fun that I wish I could stay in them forever... (i.e. Siren's Sister shows).  But nothing I would want to live over just becuase I didn't like the way that it turned out...and that's my answer.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/192372.html

I don't know, being in France on Bastille Day was pretty awesome and I would love to do that again.  But I have to say my favorite French thing is has to be the entire city of Carcassone.  It's a great medieval walled city that is just so much fun to wander through.  The rest of the city spreads out below it, because obviously it spread out after the walls were no longer useful...but it's still pretty cool.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/190716.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="949"></lj-template>Snow days that could actually be enjoyed.  Now I have to worry about how to get to work and things like that since work never shuts down.  Back in the day it was all yay no school and off you'd go into the snow...I want that back.  oh yeah, and being insane enough to float down the river on an intertube.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/190171.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="942"></lj-template>Parking garages.  they don't have to be empty, but they make me more nervous when they are. Something about the acoustics, how you can't tell what direction anything is coming from.  The low ceilings are also less than excellent.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/189866.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="934"></lj-template>Most disturbing cartoon character...hmmm...I'm going to go with children's cartoons and not count anime for this question because that opens up to many options if you count the anime.  So...Most disturbing.  Definitely Yakko from Animaniacs.  That show was so totally inappropriate for small children when I watch it now.  Followed closely by Elmyra from Tiny Toon Adventures because she tried to torture animals and called it loving them.  That was awfully scary.  Then Peppy Le Pue because he was so obsessed with love.  And that's about where I am going to end my list.  Though Donald Duck is on it, but he's down a little ways and he's mostly on there because he and the lead singer of AC/DC sound so similar it's creepy.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/189266.html
<lj-template name="qotd" id="915"></lj-template>The answer is yes, followed by a no
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/188890.html

A- Age: 23

B - Bed size: Full

C - Chore you hate: Kitty Litter boxes...mostly because there are so many

D - Dogs' names: My mum's dogs are Ayan and Hallie.  My cat is MAB

E - Essential start your day item:  yogurt, or something else I can eat while running out the door

F - Favorite color: Green

G - Gold or Silver: Silver.

H - Height: 5'7" ish, a little shorter depending on the time of day and which leg I'm standing on (That's right my legs are totally two different lengths)

I - Instruments you play:  Guitar, Piano, a mean tamborine and sometimes I just pull out the accordion and jam on it in a nonsensical fashion

J - Job title:  Staffing Clerk, CVU UC/MT

K - Kid: not in the small child sense, but I would love to have a baby goat if you're offering.

L - Living arrangements: Parents basement, with cats

M - Mum's name: Susan or Mary (not that I have two mom's but that my mom has two names)

N - Nicknames: Sayasha, Saya, shh shhh, Penguin, Prangin

O - Overnight hospital stay other than birth:  Not Ever, unless you count the odd night shift of work here and there

P - Pet Peeve: the use of your when it should be you're.  People who aren't considerate enough to call in early

Q - Quote(s) from a movie:
"I am a leaf on the wind, see how I soar"
"I aim to misbehave"
"Gosh, I sure wish we had some grenades, don't you?"
"Savvy"

R - Right or left handed: Right.

S - Siblings:  2 little sisters and a brother in law

T - Time you wake up: Usually around noon, but earlier if I must be somewhere earlier

U - Underwear: Pink, black bra with white detailing

V - Vegetable you dislike: I don't really.  I'm pretty open to most kinds of food.  Though there are plenty that I won't eat if I don't have to

W - Ways you run late: Road Construction

X - X-rays you've had: Knee (when I was 4) and lungs when I was 12

Y - Yummy food you make: Red Curry with chicken oh so tasty

Z - Zoo favorite: Albino black bear (or as we like to call him: Michael).  And the lemurs...oh the magical lemurs.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/188536.html

I have just now (almost) finished watching season 6 of Buffy, it's right up there in my most excellent seasons, along with Season 2 (which includes Angel going all evil).  Mostly Evil Willow and lots of nekkid Spike make Season 6 excellent.  And because they big bad is three kinda lame dudes, and it focuses mostly on character developement post Buffy coming back for the second time from the dead.  Though in a much more spectacular way than the first time (way to go with the CPR Xander).

It still always amazes me that Nick Brendan (Xander) has an honest to God identical twin (by the name of Kelly Donovan if memory serves) and they only played the two Xanders card for one episode.  I mean, they played Vampire Willow more times than that even.  Nick Brendan also needs to do an evil dead movie.  Because he is Bruce Campbell's heir, in my humble opinion.

Now that I have quite finished my Buffy sillyness I shall go.  Tomorrow I shall take my daddy to see the Wolverine movie.  and possibly buy season 7.  Which I also have a fondness for.  Which will mean all I am missing it season 5 (my least favorite becuase I don't really enjoy Riley). And work on my giant cross stitch dragon some more, because I enjoy it so.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/187792.html
Happy Beltane...now you heard the man! GO!
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/187605.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="880"></lj-template>that entirely depends on if it is in a wild area that I know.  Such as the Northwest of the United states.  I think I could probably go for several days around here, because I kind of am aware of what is good to eat and water is abundant.  it also depends on the time of year.  In winter, probably a much smaller amount of time.  During the spring and summer probably more as it is berry season, and NW Washington has a very large amount of naturally occurring berries.  However, in an extreme type of region (desert, antarctic, etc,) I don't think I would last more than a day.  I feel pretty confident in my Northwest outside skills though.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/187376.html
Hands down, it's The Curse of Monkey Island, followed closely by all the other monkey islands, which is followed closely by um...let's see...oh, commander keen
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/187032.html

I am looking for someone to go with me to PAX 2009 (for those not in the know it's a little shin-dig thrown by the guys who run the comic strip Penny Arcade.  Okay, not so little, rather huge, but it's got a lot of cool gaming shit and I want to go.) It runs the 4th, 5th, and 6th of September.  If you're interested in joining me let me know.  Pre-registration is open now and it is only $50 for all three days.  When I say gaming I also don't mean exclusively platform gaming in case you are confused.  I mean full on any type of thing that might be considered a game (Including D&D and Magic)  So...yeah...
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/186625.html

So, I have just written the first pattern that I have ever written for knitting...I think that's pretty exciting.  I'll have to post some pictures up here at some point.  They are small green wrist warmer thingies with thumb holes (so technically they cover half of my hand I guess).  I made them only about 4 inches long.  I think it would be really cool to do it on the 8's again with the rib stitch part at the beginning and end in worsted weight and then make the patterned section out of fingering weight yarn because it would look really fish-netty.  It would also be cool to make them like that to go up above the elbow.  That would be sweet.  I might try that with some variegated that I have left over and the sugar yarn that I have, but I need to go back to working on my socks.  I just needed a short break so remember what working with normal sized needles felt like.  It feels really weird now.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/186394.html

The one of Collan Rosvenir.  It's truly epic, but as I don't really write/rant about the exiles that often anymore.  Which isn't to say that I've gotten over the fact that there still isn't a third book, but I've stopped talking about it because it just hurts too much!

I don't really know what else I could use this user pic for other than my odd now and then exiles rants.  I did used to rant about it quite often.  Though this seems as good a place as any to mention that Melanie Rawn (said author of Exiles books) has another book coming out on the 14th of April that isn't the Captal's Tower...but I will read it anyway, because I don't want her to get discouraged and stop writing altogether because then I am doomed to an eternity of never knowing who Collan's parents and/or grandparents are...I wonder how many people will flip straight to the back of that book whenever it comes out in the future just to get a look at the geneaology chart that will undoubtedly be in the back (or will she fool us and just give us a lecture on genetics again hm?  Not that the section on genetics of faradhi and diarmadhi was bad, mind you, just a little  bit excessive.  Though it does show that she really has thought things through a lot more thoroughly that is perhaps necessary.)
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/186322.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="801"></lj-template>Well...Let's see...this is a little bit difficult.  I would have to say that I would bring Melanie Rawn's Exiles books (so there are two spots gone) and the omnibus collection of all three of the Black Jewel's trilogy books by Anne Bishop combined into one book (you see, I save space that way and can still bring two more books), some heavier reading in the form of Dante's Inferno because I could spend all day reading and re-reading one canto of that.  Let's see...for my fifth book...hmmm...hard...what would I bring?  Ideally it would be the third book of the Exiles trilogy (y'know, the captal's Tower? the one that still doesn't exist, 15 years later?) so there you go!
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/185632.html

So...Alan Tudyk (better known as Wash from Firefly/Serenity) is totally going to (has already been) in Dollhouse!  I'm so excited!  He's playing a quasi-bad guy/ experiment gone horribly horribly wrong.  Basically he's a doll that has managed to retain some form of multiple imprints and went insane and killed a bunch of people and now has it out for the entire dollhouse (with some special attention focused on Echo).  Yeah, he's Alpha.  I'm so stoked.  Though I have problems imagining Adam in the role.  However, he always plays excellent naked people, so I'm all for it.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/185444.html

1. Open your library (iTunes, Winamp, Media Player, iPod, etc)
2. Put it on shuffle
3. Press play
4. For the first question, type the song that's playing
5. When you go to a new question, press the next button TWICE
6. Don't lie and try to pretend you're cool...just type it in man!
7. Tag 10 people, and they have to do it too :)- if they want, no pressure, but it's fun!! I make a point of never tagging anyone, so I'm skipping this step.

IF YOUR LIFE WAS A MOVIE WHAT WOULD THE SOUNDTRACK BE?

Opening Credits:  "Consoler of the Lonely" by The Raconteurs

Waking Up: "Hold On" by Siren's Sister

First Day at School:  "But Honestly" by the Foo Fighters

Falling in Love: "Death of Seasons" by AFI (why do I always get AFI when the question/category involves love?)

Fight Song: "Bandages" by Hot Hot Heat (wow, I'm imagining that I don't do very well in my fights, hey?)

Breaking Up: "Hard to Love" by Old Crow Medicine Show (which is also an appropriate song, my mp3 player must be psychic)

Prom: "Horrible Theme" from the Dr. Horrible Soundtrack (ROFL)

Mental Breakdown: "There is a Light That Never Goes Out" by The Smiths

Driving: "Highway Forever" by The Presidents of the United States of America (see, I keep saying it's psychic, but...)

Flashback: "No.13 Baby" by the Pixies (this would make for a trippy flashback)

Getting Back Together: "Run to Black" from the Serenity soundtrack

Wedding: "Groovy Times" by The Clash (oh highlarious)

Birth of Child: "Dear Prudence" by Siouxsie and the Banshees

Final Battle: "Top Yourself" by the Raconteurs (because really, how can I top my initial fight music?)

Death Scene: "Everything you ever wanted" from the Dr. Horrible soundtrack

Ending Credits: "Two of us" by the Beatles

well, that makes for an entirely too interesting movie of my life.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/185138.html

So...If you're bored at the moment and like good music, or if you just like good music.  You should check out the Lonely Forest.  A little band from Anacortes that just got signed this year.  New Cd coming out in April and you can hear the first two singles at: www.wesingintime.com  They are pretty excellent.  They also put on a good show, so go check out their myspace and see when you might be able to catch them.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/184816.html

I've done this meme once before...but I've decided to do it once again...since my music library has expanded greatly since the last time...

Step 1: Put your music player on shuffle.
Step 2: Post the first line from the first 25 songs that play, no matter how embarrassing.
Step 3: Strike through the songs when someone guesses both artist and track correctly.
Step 4: For those who are guessing -- looking the lyrics up on Google is CHEATING!
Step 5: If you like the game post your own

1.  Biting through tongues and foaming at the mouths.


2. The common man doesn't suffer pain like this.

3. You got my pride hanging out of my bed

4.  There's a tower in the heart of London

5. Staring at the white above, can't tell if I'm alive or if I'm dead

6. Cars of today are like kids in a way

7. Drug Market...sub market...sometimes I wonder why I ever got in?

8. Sick boy in faded blue jeans

9.  It sometimes feels like a burden ((note: this one originally came up as an instrumental song, so I skipped it and took the next one))

10.  I need an easy friend

11.  Careless in our summer clothes splashing around in the muck and the mire

12. Good morning heartache, you're like an old friend

13.  This hole is my home.  It's far underground

14.  With you it's never good enough because you want the stuff that could change your future

15.  Chase the sun in my head Blistered skin turning red

16.  I can remember a place I used to go chrysanthemums of white so beautiful

17. When i come home baby and I've been working all night long

18.  Don't waste your touch, you won't feel anything, or where you sent to save me?

19.  The Friday sun bears down as we drive with our friends

20.  Well, she's fashionably lean, and she's fashionably late

21.  Upon this street where time has died, the golden treat you never tried

22.  You got your life cut short no chance for what you wanted to do

23.  All because of you all because of...

24. Time to live time to lie time to laugh time to die

25.  It feels like your lifes crashing down around you

And there it is...I think there are very few of these songs that will actually get guessed because most of the songs that came up in this aren't even mine they are CDs that i've gleaned from Sarah and Mary for the sake of being a musical collector...heheh hheheh.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/182072.html

So, I finished the vast majority of my christmas shopping now all I have to do is knit up a storm in the next couple of days.  Which should be very boring but fun.  I bought myself a cheap ass CD player for my room...OMG the cheap soundingness of it is so horrible.  But it plays music and that's all that really matters.  Now I am totally off to knit, you know?
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/181517.html

I've already decided on one of my new years resolutions...

Take more photos...of everything.  Because you can truly never have enough photos...and with handy internet storage devices there's no limit to the organizing and stuff that I can do with them...and I truly need more photos.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/181048.html

I really do miss Buffy the Vampire Slayer.  I feel like that show could have done on forever.  I also miss FIrefly...because that show went before it even really had a chance to begin.  I can't think of anything else...at the moment I am pretty sure there are about a million other shows that I miss...oooooh that reboot of the ghost busters cartoon show that was pretty darn good.

I'm watching Colbert and he's so bizarre.  Hmm...what to post.  I'm a little disappointed because I didn't realize that Repo was opening in like super limited release, which means like 8 cities in the states, none of which are Seattle, and they're only in Seattle for one night which is the 11th, and I happen to work that day...what a bummer.  However, two of those cities are San Fran and Berkeley, which I am right next to later this month so maybe I will have to go and look up a showing while there if it's still in the theatre, otherwise I will wait for the DVD and order it immediately when it comes out so that I can have my very own Repo event...I'll even invite the cast, maybe they'll come you never know where my wishful thinking will get me, huh?

Nate had a really good day today, which causes me to be stoked, but I should probably get to bed pretty soon since I have to work tomorrow morning during the day shift time.  He took 30 steps with a RN helping him.  That's so good, but he might stay there if the rehab he had to go through is just short term.  We just don't know yet, probably more details at the end of the week.  I'm so happy that he's that far today...he also wished happy birthday to his dad.  Yay for all of us November babies.  We rock.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/178367.html

So, I know that I was having weird dreams last night...but other than the overall feeling that they were much like an adventure game where I was fighting monsters and solving puzzles...I don't remember much of them...except that it seemed simpler and I didn't want to wake up even though I knew it was a dream.  **le sigh** I am so full of ennui lately...why isn't ennui a mood option?
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/177396.html

I'd have to say that Evil Dead is right up there, right next to Army of Darkness.  Those probably beat any other horror movie, because although I enjoy the occasional Saw and Texas Chainsaw Massacre, I probably won't watch those multiple times...but those two movies I could watch over and over again and they never get old.  I always find them funny and a little terrifying.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/176839.html
Why is it almost 4am and my entire family is awake?  What happened to my peaceful 4am, where no one was awake but me?  This is too weird...I'm going to bed.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/176176.html

I don't know that there are any more ground-breaking comedians.  I am sure that there is ground left to break, but I am just not sure where it is.  I think that a lot of that ground is in niche comedy.  y'know, comedy that only certain crowds of people will really understand.  And that by and large most people won't find funny at all.  That's just my opinion on it.  Man I miss George Carlin.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/175741.html

I finally went back to my neighbors last evening to take pictures of the progress of the orchids, and thus I have more gorgeous pictures for the internets!


This one is entirely new.  It must have been about to bloom last time, but I didn't notice, blinded as I was by the hundreds of orchids.  I think it's a very cool shade of purple.  Next to that is a picture of my favorite one, yes it's the same flower as last time, but now it's changed and darkened.  I think it still looks pretty sweet.

Here's the white one from last time, now you can see that there's a little bit of yellow in the middle of it.  I thought that was interesting.  None of the rest of them changed all that much so I'm not going to show pictures of them.

And to round us out here are some adorable pictures of Lennon that I took while he was in the mood out on the warm cement.  Isn't he just almost the most adorable thing you've ever seen?  I thought so.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/175163.html

I completed my sweater vest that I have been knitting over the weekend!  I have pictures to prove it.  I took so long to post because I wanted to get more orchid pictures to put up here and I was about to, but then I remembered that Dad was gone and that he has the keys to the neighbors house, so perhaps there will be more orchid pictures later tonight.  It's interesting that the flowers continue to change after they have bloomed.

So...sweater vest pictures!

Here it is in all of it's finished glory.  It has two cables up the sides obviously and is worked in one piece in the round, splitting at the armholes and grafted at the shoulders.  It was surprisingly quick and easy to make.  It also took less yarn than it said it would...though I may have made it a little shorter (by maybe a quarter inch) than it said the final length was supposed to be.  If I do it again in a different color I will probably work another inch or two before does the waist shaping and maybe another inch before the armholes so that it is a little longer.  The color is called (like the title of this post) High plains Varg (what the hell varg means I don't know...I may have to go and hit dictionary.com).  I ordered a black long-sleeved shirt from oldnavy.com to wear underneath it (I'm going to order other colors as well next payday)  I'm also thinking of going back and getting some tweedy type yarn and making it in that as well because it's be pretty cool looking in a more solid type of color.  I used Patons Shetland Chunky because the pattern calls for a bulky yarn.  I also have a close up of one of the cable to post.

The yarn seemed to be self-striping for a while and then when I switched skeins it was no longer...but I like the way it turned out with the big eye drops of color seemingly bleeding into the front.  I think it's very cool.

I also have some pictures (or attempted pictures) of the moon taken last wednesday during craft night by Anna and myself (our picture proues is not so much).  The moon looked really cool...unfortunately it appears there isn't a good way to capture it on a digital camera...who knew?

I call the first one Moon Swirl (because I've given them all semi-artistic sounding names so as to make my moon picture failure a success!) and the second one Moon Puddle.  I like to make jokes that you might be able to tell the future by staring at them...much like the entrails of various animals...or tea leaves in the bottom of yoru tea cup.

And lastly I call this one Moon Mist...for no particular reason except that Moon Puddle was already taken by the preceeding picture.  I think they look pretty cool though and give you a good idea of at least what color the moon was that night if not what shape exactly...or where it was in the sky.  I need to go see if there's a good way of taking picture of the moon with your basic digital camera...I doubt there is you probably need a fancy camera with a cool lense...maybe I'll ask Stefan...he probably knows...picture guru that he be.

Finally I have one more photo for this edition of Grace has lost her mind and begun posting shit loads of photos -why?  Because I can!

HAH!  My daddy on his lawn mower.  He's obsessed with mowing the lawn...no joke...and you see all of that dirt behind him?  Yeah that's going to be used to level our lawn, no joke on that either...the back of our house is kind of a valley type of thing having a big hill on one side and leading to a low place.  We're going to put a fence around it once we've finished leveling it...which may be forever from now.  And he's totally just making that face because I'm taking his picture...and I didn't go to yoga with him that day...what?  It was at noon and that's way to early!
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/175014.html

I went out tonight and gathered my snack for craft noc tomorrow (something that I am greatly looking forward to since in my opinion it's a jolly old time).  Now, you may think that by going out and getting it I mean I went to the store...but oh dear reader, how you would be mistaken.  After I showered I put on a sweat shirt with a hood and grabbed a plastic bag in order to walk down the road to an apple tree in someone's front yard that I had been eyeing for a few days now.  It looks to me to be a Spartan apple tree since they are late apples (often read in mid to late September) and where they are exposed to the sun have a very deep red color.  It's also right next to a horse pasture.  So stealthly in the night I filled up a plastic bag full of the Spartan apples I could reach...it's probably a good thing I did it in the dark because that way I couldn't see any spiders that were on the tree.  Now I just need to wash them all off tomorrow morning and inspect them, making sure I got good ones.  I few of them may be under ripe, but most of the ones I tugged on came off the tree with ease.  That is how I tell if an apple is ripe.  Plus I figure I will buy a little of the cream cheese fruit dip to go with them and maybe chop up some cheddar cheese (because cheese and apples are also divine).  I have a hat to work on and the strap to a bag that I need to finish up.  

Other than that my dad and I might go do yoga tomorrow.  Or maybe just me because dad seems to fear yoga a bit more than I do.  But I'm excited about it.  It's at noon tomorrow.  How sweet.  So I better get to bed soon.  I have to go continue reading America.  Also everyone I sent cookies to seems to have gotten them by now, to much praise and adoration of myself.  I enjoy sending people cookies for just that reason... and that if I was ever anywhere I hope that they would do the same for me.  Probably do up another batch closer to Halloween to send off. whooo

Also Mary graduates from drug court next week (kind of glad I won't be going anymore, because if you start to think about it for to long it's just really depressing).  Drug court wants her to sing for them, but she won't sing without me.  So thus have Mary and I come up with an entire harmony of our own for Scarbourough Fair.  Yes, that's what we did the entire super long ride back into Lynden.  We didn't listen to any music, we made our own.  Often just repeating one line over and over again until we finally got a harmony that worked.  We're basically our own musical geniuses.  Now if only I had a working piano, I could write it down.  I might have to go borrow Dad's keys to the neighbors house again.
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/174779.html

My neighbors went out of town today and will be gone through the end of September and as per usual my daddy is taking care of their garden and their giant room full of orchids...so I being the adventurer that I am proccurred the keys from my daddy and went to visit the orchids...I didn't count on having to face down this giant spider though...

Yep, I had to get past him, not twice, but four times since I forgot my camera the first time I went over...and how can I prove that I was in Orchid Land if there are no pictures to back me up? So to give you an idea of the amount of orchids my neighbor has i'll show you a few pictures of the room before we get to the six ones that were blooming.

So as you can see, this room is covered in flowers, there's a bunch in the middle, two big things in front of the big windows out front and one three tier one by the little window on the side.  It has a special floor and a hose inside of it so that you just mist the flowers in there and don't need to worry about ruining any flooring or anything at all.  He's a real hard core grower.  At some point I'll have to get a photo of all of the ribbons he has up on the wall that are awards for things.  ONTO THE BLOOMS!

This is one that is almost done, it's got kind of light purple outer petals and a white center with some brilliant purple on it.  I was struggling to find the best setting for my camera which is why this photo turned out a little blurry.  It's set on the center pedestal in the room.  Right next to it are these little yellow ones that kind of remind me of snap dragons a little bit.  They're on a really long stem and there are a lot more of them. they're really fine and tiny.

When I think of orchids this is basically what I think of.  The classic white orchid.  These look really good.  I like the way the picture turned out.  They seem so simple and clean.  Right next to those before the next ones that were easily visible where these little ones.  They were really little as well, and kind of hard to see because the outer petals are a really light green color and they overhand the purple tongue like parts.  

These ones looked pretty newly bloomed so I'll see how they develop through the week.  They look like the classic white but are different colors.  Then on the three tier one is my favorite blooming orchid of the moment I just think it's gorgeous.  The flowers are the most unique in the room and they're huge.  I also really like the color scheme.  Super cool.  I kinda want to take it home.  But I'm resisting y'know.

That was about all of the adventure I had in Orchid Land today, but as my neighbor is gone for quite some time I know there will be more that I can share with you.  It's pretty awesome.  They also have a large baby grand piano which I like to stare at.

Sometimes, when I can't think of titles for my posts, I just open up I-tunes and pick a likely looking song title.  Or just type in the first phrase I hear on the television if it's a good one.  I think it's a fairly decent way of making a name for a post.  The song I chose to name this post after has to be one of my favorite songs by the band (which is Brand New in case you didn't know)  It's a very hauntingly beautiful but sad song.  It isn't really about anything specific, but more like relationships and life in general and how sometimes there's just no way that things are going to work out.  It's really pretty and acoustical.  I like it.  I like to sing it in harmony with the Mary face.

Today wasn't horrible.  Work started out a little rough, but it settled as it usually does when people stop panicking and begin working with what they have been given to work with.  Night shift worked out okay.

I've been thinking about moving out, which I would love to do, but it's so expensive.  So i'm slowly trying to gain money, but I would like to finish with my car payments first and actually be paying for my insurance (which means I need to take a day to do the transfer of title things with my mom, so that the car is mine in name).  I'm glad Mary and Wes are finally off of my cell phone bill, so I don't have to worry about that.  I just need to get my shit together...and stop paying for things for Mary...because I don't need to spend money on her.

In other exciting news Stefan said something to Audrey about wanting to get married in the spring...so now we're all just waiting on a ring and a proposal...which may mean that I'll be in another dress come spring.  I think it would be exciting.  I really like Stefan and Audrey together, they're both out going and have great work ethic, and Stefan isn't terrified of hanging out with her friends.  Which has been a problem with past boyfriends.  I really enjoy hanging out with him.  I hope he does propose, though if he wants a spring wedding that doesn't give Audrey a lot of time to plan.

I can't sleep...I may have to read more...or stop Lennon from eating small chains that turn on lamps...whilst I massage him.  Lennon can't help it that he need special kitty massages from me at 2 in the morning.  And there is now hair everywhere, and he's trying to lick my fingers whilst I type...well, isn't that not as much fun as I thought it would be.  So the cookies got sent off earlier today for places across the country (these are surely far traveling cookies as they are going to Washington DC, Montana x 2, Ellensburg, and Seattle).  Everyone gets 13 sugar cookies of excellentness each, and they are excellent, because I had a few left over and I may have eaten one or two of them and they were tasty...plus we send sugar cookies because they keep well.

Anyway, perhaps I shall go and read now.  Reading will make me go to bed eventually...perhaps I'll read my new book.  It's called Book of Lies by Brad Meltzer.  If you go to the web site for it it has a silly promotional video that has Joss Whedon and Brian K. Vaughn on it.  It's really pretty cool.  So away I go.

Well, I succeeded in running a mile in about 12 minutes and a few seconds...it was way harder than I thought it would be to push myself that hard.  Afterwards I walked for about another mile to cool down.  And then did some of the weight machines with my daddy.  Yep, that's right I work out with my daddy...who for some bizarre reason refuses to go ice blocking with me.  What's up with that?  I think it would be good for him...if it didn't kill him that is.

Started today by going and switching cell phone plans around so that Mary and Wes have their own plan and are no longer on mine.  Which means that I get to stop worrying about having to collect hundreds of dollars from them every month to pay my bill (seriously, the bill was often over 200 dollars, which is more than any cell phone bill should ever be in my book).  I also got a new phone which is green and shiny and when you call it it shall play Inside Out by Eve 6.  So if you're having a bad day and just need to rock out to some Eve 6 feel free to call me.  I'll try not to pick up right away.

Shortly after this outing I went and picked up the third and final season of Veronica Mars...which is sad because that show had so much potential.  I wish it had continued also because Jason Doherty is hot.  I've also been making my way through the first season of Trinity Blood, which I am enjoying.  On my PS3.  I love my PS3 best $400 I ever spent let me tell you.

Then this evening I went out to dinner with Audrey, Krystal, Stefan, Sarah, and Mark.  Which was nice.  We went to the Black Forest and I had the bar steak which is delicious and also really well priced.  I get it medium rare because I like my steak a little bloody in the middle.  Afterwards we went to Audrey's and watched Over Her Dead Body, which was pretty humorous.  After that everyone went home, but being the night owl that I am this couldn't possibly be the end for me.  Apparently Lacy was going to come to dinner and then called Audrey back and said she had a head ache.  I mean...come on, Black Forest is seriously right across the street from her house...I think that Mark and Sarah just make her uncomfortable because they are married and so is Krystal, and Audrey has Stefan.  I think she's just way to sensitive to couples.  I mean Josh wasn't even there.  And it's not like they are the types of people who maliciously rub their coupleness in others faces.  I just don't get it.

So when I got home my dad and I went to homestead to work out because mom wants him (and me as well) to work out at least 3 times a week, whether that be a bike ride or going to homestead in the middle of the night.  So we did 30 minutes on the elliptical machines (which I can apparently go 2.25 miles during, on the hills course.  In flip flops none the less)  I ran a 13 minute mile which is my best to date including all the times they tried to make me run it in middle school.  So my next goal is a 12 minute mile on the elliptical machine and after that my goal will be 3 miles in 30 minutes.  So moving along slowly.

I also bought the Dr. Horrible sound track today.  It's so excellent.  I burned it onto a CD and I have it in my car and I sing along to it at the top of my lungs and cackle when I find it funny (which is most of the time).  So if you see someone in a black escape driving around cackling and singing at the top of their lungs that would be me.  I promise, i'll try not to run you over in a fit of mirth.

A) People who have been tagged must write their answers on their blogs & replace any question that they dislike with a new question formulated by themselves.

B) Tag 8 10 some people who probably won't beat me up :') to do this quiz & those who are tagged cannot refuse. These people must state who they were tagged by & cannot tag the person whom they were tagged by. Continue this game by sending it to other people.     


1. What are your nicknames?
     Penguin, Prangin, Gracie, I think that's about it...I know, I have great nick names.

2. Who do you RL ship the hardest (friends on or offline, relatives, celebrities, JUST PEOPLE WHO ARE REAL)?
I don't know...I don't think I know what the RL stands for and thus shall stand here confused like an interweb newb

3. What fandom(s) are you most into at the moment?
Hm...that's really hard because I like a lot of them, but I haven't like actively participated in a lot of them...Melanie Rawn most assuredly, some Anne Bishop and Jacqueline Carey, right now it's mostly authors...oh wait, JOSS WHEDON IS MY MASTER...that would be accurate...

4. How do you smell?
    Not like cow shit anymore...though perhaps the scent still lingers...I'm always worried about that.  My nose was at some point so accustomed to the smell I could never be sure if I smell or not...kind of disturbing.

    Let's see Folklore, because it's awesome.  The little mini-game for Ratchet and Clank Future and Monkey Island 1 & 2 because they are LOST!  This is the most tragic thing of all time...you should know this.

    The theme music to Monkey Island because it would be really easy to laugh maniacally (also anyone I killed wouldn't really be dead because you can't die in Monkey Island)

7. Do you trust easily?
    Yes and no.  No because I'm not gullible.  Yes because I do tend to start out taking what people say at face value...but if you lie...then that stops.

8. If the person you secretly like is already taken, what would you do?
    Generally, if the person they are dating is nice, wish them well of it.  However, if the person they are dating is underhanded and sneaky then I hope that they realize it and come crying to me. 

9. Is there anything that has made you unhappy these days?
    Not particularly.  Can't say that there is.  Oh not being able to find Patu to give him his arthritis stuff this morning.  What the heck cat?

10. Do you have a good body-image?
      I'm not sure if this question means am I always ragging on myself about my body image, well no, I'm pleased with where I am...I could stand to lose quite a bit of weight, but i'm in no hurry about it.  I bike ride and take long walks, and play frisbee with the dogs (for which my cat gets really angry with me for) but i'm in no hurry to lose weight.  It'll come off when it comes off.

      Totally splendiferous.  It makes me feel like people know i'm here.

       I'd love to travel the world being all anthropological and looking at different cultures stories...it'd be cool, maybe i'd wear a hat.

Okay, not really, but I always fear that when I restring my guitar and I'm tuning it afterwards...that one of the little strings is going to snap and hit me in the face.  Because that would hurt a whole lot and probably cut you as well...and then my guitar would be good and blooded...as opposed to the way I make my fingers bleed on it regularly.  I did restring it today, and now i'm all happy because it's got super shiney bronze strings.  mmm...good.  However they are lights and not mediums because my fingers just aren't quite strong enough to work on the mediums for extended periods of time so I went with the lights.

I have some pictures for you...

This is the head of my dear guitar, and obviously I haven't taken the wire cutters to it just yet...the most aggravating thing about restringing a guitar is that for the first hour or so it seems like you have to tune it every fifteen minutes because the strings are still stretching out and stuff...and don't make fun of my lame winding of the string...I always do it lamely...it's like my trademark or something.

Here be the body with it's shiney new strings...at some point in the future I want to get like custom pegs for the bottom...I wonder if you can get them with skulls and cross bones?  If not i'll buy some and paint them myself yo.

And here's my whole gorgeous baby...laying on the couch...Have I mentioned that my cat hates my guitar because it takes both of my hands, there fore one hand cannot be petting her...oh she has a desire to kill it...no fury like a kitty scorned you know...and then just to end on something adorable...

LENNON IN A BIRDBATH!  It's adorable I know...post this he went into a tree...which I also have pictures of but I am not going to show them to the internet right now.

So, went and looked at that house my mother was interested in today and what a HUGE disappointment.  It was way worse than billed...there's a fixer upper and then there's something that just needs to be torn down and rebuilt.  Dad and I could see that it needed more work than it was worth just from walking around the outside.  Number one easily seeable was that though it had new windows, those windows were crooked.  And number two it didn't even have aluminum siding, it was plastic and also on crooked and needed to be badly replaced.  Glancing in a few of the windows it was easy to tell that the whole place (or at least the downstairs) needed to be gutted.  So, in conclusion make sure you check the above things before buying a house...or at least bring my dad with you so he can talk a good $20,000 off the price.  Disappointing because it does have in it somewhere the ability to be a really nice house, but it's going to take a lot of work and a lot of applying for permits and jack hammering and digging out of foundations...just way to much work.  Dad needs to work on a house that doesn't need that much structural heavy duty work...plumbing and wiring are both workable.

Other than that though I basically sat around all day playing Rock Band with Mary.  That was pretty good.  Except Wes called like every fifteen minutes...maybe they should just attach an umbilical cord to eachother...it might be more convenient for everyone else...or develope telepathy...that would help too.  Now I'm off to take a shower because I feel yucky because the sun burn on my scalpe is finally peeling off.  WHOOT!
http://sayashaw.livejournal.com/170740.html

So, I was thinking today, don't ask me why, because as I do timecards all sorts of things float through my head...most of them having to do with wanting to do something other than timecards, about being single and it's positives and negatives.  On the bright side I don't really have to be concerned about anyone's reactions to what I might do like one would with a significant other, if I get drunk and do embarassing things it's not going to embarass anyone, except maybe the people I am with and well, they chose to be around at that point.  On the other hand one of the worst parts about being single is knowing that all your other friends who are coupled up, you're not their first thought if they're worried or need to vent or anything like that...which I may be the only one bothered by that in the whole world, but I do enjoy feeling needed just every once in a while.  I've felt rather like an extra appendage lately, through no fault of the people i've been kickin' it with...it's just been a feeling.  Once again though, it's not like a relationship is really something that I am actively looking for...so what the solution to this feeling is I am just not sure...it to shall come to pass...like most things.  

I've been reading a lot lately, which also causes me great happiness. I haven't read for the pure love of reading in oh so very long.  It's nice and rather relaxing.  I also have finally picked my guitar up again and decided that I obviously need new strings, so that may be a task for tuesday, restring ye old guitar because it needs it badly...perhaps I can convince my father to buy me strings....hmm... Since I do use an awful lot of gas on him.  There are many things I am glad I get to do again now that I've graduated.

Also my mother is talking about investing money in another house because she wants to buy now while it's cheap and sell post Olympics when everything will basically quadruple in price.  She's got her eye on this adorable ancient house out in Blaine.  She thinks dad needs a long term project which this would be since there's real potential that it's going to need something like all new plumbing (which my dad is capable of doing) and it also needs to be leveled.  It's really cute though, it's got a BALCONY.  Which I think is a major selling point.  Balconies are awesome. It was built in 1897 which means there is probably government money for anyone willing to restore it to some semblance of historically accurate condition.  But that does mean only using certain colors and stuff and there's a lot of paperwork to fill out.   I volunteered to live where ever she does decide to buy because you don't want to leave a house empty in this county...Trust me, I spend every Tuesday with kids who have gotten caught (or admitted to) breaking into those houses and throwing parties.  Scary stuff man.

So, I think I may be done now.  It's been a while since I've written such a long journal entry...interesting...perhaps this is something else I shall do now that I have graduated with me BA.  I should probably at some point edit my info on this or something...geez.

<lj-template name="qotd" id="507"></lj-template> So, this is a very interesting question for me.   Since there are so many fictional characters that I love, but the question is would I be able to put up with them as the sole person to talk to on an island.  Given this doesn't say a desert island, so that's a plus.  Let's make it an  island where we have plenty of food so that cannibalizing each other is out of the question. So the first ficitonal character my mind jumps to would have to be Collan Rosvenir from the Exiles books by Melanie Rawn.  He is my biggest fictional character crush and has been for almost  more than a decade.  I can't really see a downside to it, he's pretty so I get me some eye candy, he's musical so we can work on our harmony and learn songs from each other to while away the hours, and he's a bit of a womanizer, at least early in the book he is.  So, all in all, I think he would have to be my choice.
